website_summaries.verdict: A good choice if you are looking for an alternative material, but somewhat inconvenient.
pros: Hard anodized surface is strong and nonstick
Aluminum core heats quickly and cooks evenly
cons: It's heavy, and the lid seems flimsy and ill-fitting
Cleaning in the dishwasher is not recommended

customer_reviews.title: Too Small: Sold as a 3-Quart Pot but Only Holds 2
customer_reviews.text: This pot is much smaller than advertised. Indeed, I sent the first one back, assuming that Amazon had made a mistake. But indeed, the replacement was just as tiny. Advertised as a 3-quart pot, it really only holds 2 quarts in practical use and overflows at 2.5 quarts. The advertised dimensions are 8 inches by 7 inches, but I measured the external diameter as 7.5 inches and height at 4.5 inches. Indeed if you do the math, a cylinder of 7.5 inches by 4.5 inches has a volume of only 1.85 quarts. On the other hand, if this pot was the stated size of 8 by 7 inches, it would indeed hold 3.03 quarts.
customer_reviews.author: Seattle

customer_reviews.title: Long-term pan endurance is not particularly great.
customer_reviews.text: I have had this pan for two years. It seems well-constructed, but over the course of two years (never under high heat, always hand washed and only used to cook soup), the bottom starts warping a bit inward on a gas range such that it's imbalanced now. I am hesitant to recommend this over a longer duration for this reason, but two years out of a heavily used saucepan (probably every other day in a home setting) is ok.
customer_reviews.author: Rich P

customer_reviews.title: not good! Never too old to learn
customer_reviews.text: Bought it to replace a coated pot after I noticed that the non-stick coating was beginning to rub off on my dish towel...not good! Never too old to learn:-). Have anodized fry pans but not pots, so decided to try. This pot heats up quickly and is absolutely non-stick. I am very pleased with the weight of it also;it’s heavy but not so heavy that my arthritic hands and wrists can’t lift easily! The price is added bonus so next time I need a piece of cook ware, I am going to check out this brand!
customer_reviews.author: S. Maeker

customer_reviews.title: Great service - Three month review.
customer_reviews.text: I've had this pan for about three months and it works as well as the decade old Calphalon that it replaced. It's used on a daily basis and so far hasn't had any problems. No sticking and no scratches in the coating, so it's pass the preliminary durability test. As with all non-stick cookware, the real test is the test of time.
customer_reviews.author: DW

customer_reviews.title: A very good inexpensive saucepan.........
customer_reviews.text: Cooks Standard 1-Quart Hard Anodized Nonstick Saucepan with Lid, Black I bought this saucepan on June 4 2018. Have used it almost daily. Heavy and thick were my first impressions of the pan. Made of heavy aluminum and a sturdy riveted handle. My favorite feature is the non-stick surface. My son cooks six eggs for breakfast daily and is so easy to clean. Now the reason for the four stars..... the coating on the rivets started to come off soon after about a month of cleaning. See attached picture. Overall, I enjoy using this pan, but I wish the coating was better on the rivest. FIVE STARS PAN... one star coating.
customer_reviews.author: S. L.

customer_reviews.title: Exclusive use ...
customer_reviews.text: Searched long and hard for a good quality small non-stick for exclusive use for our two portion morning porridge. We needed something top notch to pair with our Bob’s Scots Porridge Oats. Only complaints might be that the handle to body weight ratio and resulting center of gravity causes the pan to tip when empty if you’re not careful. Also the lid is difficult to have cracked open as the non-slip surface is efficiently so. Some kind of internal marker for cups one, two, three etc would be handy. So whilst not perfect for our hallowed purpose - this is a very good little pan and we’ve become quite attached to it.
customer_reviews.author: pickymickey

customer_reviews.title: Well Designed Great Pot
customer_reviews.text: Cooks 2 qt pot has a great shape making it easy to clean, fit well over stove burners, and easy kitchen storage. Lid fits tightly and vent hole eliminates surprise boil over. Nonstick coating has proved very durable. Pot instructions caution that pot handle can get very warm. While it probably doesn't get any warmer than other pots I own, it is wise to heed that caution.
customer_reviews.author: M. Otten

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Pots and Pans
customer_reviews.text: I bought this pan to go along with a matching pair of saute pans from the same brand. After 18 months this pan is till holding up well. The non-stick coating is still working well and the pan still looks nice. I would buy this again... if it ever wears out.
customer_reviews.author: D. K. Lawson

customer_reviews.title: It cleans very easily and cooks very well
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband to cook his breakfast oatmeal or grits. He loves it. It cleans very easily and cooks very well. The vent hole in the lid is a great feature.
customer_reviews.author: Dog Lover

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and a great size.
customer_reviews.text: I love this pot. It is a perfect size and depths for use with almost anything. It is easy to clean (I only hand wash my pots and pans).
customer_reviews.author: Christy W.

customer_reviews.title: Just perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Really love this pot! Perfect for oatmeal and corn meal mush — nothing sticks! Tried another pan which vented/poured on both sides. Design just didn’t work because you couldn’t get away from the steam. This pot is vented only from the lid, traditional design, and just perfect!

customer_reviews.title: good pan..bad lid.
customer_reviews.text: The pan...very nice. works as expected. The lid...not so nice. Has a metal handle, and it gets HOT...there's no excuse for having a metal handle on a saucepan lid any more. If I had seen that it was metal, I wouldn't have purchased.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent cookwear
customer_reviews.text: Extremely well packaged, heavy duty, attractive & easy to clean cook pots. Heat is evenly distributed. Truly nonstick. I have others that are considered top brands, but these cook pots are the best by far.

customer_reviews.text: This pan is amazing!! Evenly cooks and very durable!! It does say not to refrigerate because it messes up coating. I love the size and how nice it looks. Recommend

customer_reviews.title: 2 big drawbacks
customer_reviews.text: 1. It's a heavy pan and the way the handle is angled, it is not easy to lift a full pot of soup off the stove. (I work out 3x/week and do not have any problem with my Calphalon or Cuisinart pans.) 2. Contrary to what others have said, mine does not have a stay-cool handle. So there you are, lifting an awkwardly heavy pan while trying to keep your potholder from slipping. A recipe for getting burned. A clean look, yes, but this pan is just a pretty face. Poor value.
customer_reviews.author: Artsfan

customer_reviews.title: 2 quart hard anodized saucepan
customer_reviews.text: It's too early. I've only had it about a week. I need to use it for at least a few months. I will give it three stars anyway even though it'll probably take 4 or 5 stars
customer_reviews.author: RON J. CANTAGALLO

customer_reviews.title: Excellent purchase
customer_reviews.text: The other reviewers are right -- this is a very high quality item for the price. Super sturdy, almost like a light cast iron, with a true nonstick interior. I love the small size -- it's perfect for heating a single can of soup or cooking a single serving of oatmeal. In fact, I've noticed that it's more effective at both of these tasks than the last small saucepan I had, which boiled over easily. My theory is that the heat distribution with this high-quality product is superior, producing an even heating pattern; my oatmeal always bubbles right to the surface without ever spilling over.
customer_reviews.author: Carol

customer_reviews.title: I Love this Pot
customer_reviews.text: It's heavy duty and is truly, truly non-stick. I like the vent hole in the lid. I also have this in the 2 qt size. I only use nylon or silicone utensils for stirring, and generally hand wash both pots in warm, soapy water. I rarely use my dishwasher as I live alone and don't do much cooking. But the few times I've put them in the dishwasher, they came out fine.
customer_reviews.author: clmpdx

product_meta.title: Cooks Standard 3-Quart Hard Anodized Nonstick Saucepan with Lid, Black
product_meta.description: Size:3-QuartThe Cooks Standard Hard Anodized Nonstick Saucepan with Lid, Black has a hard anodized surface that is harder than stainless steel, dense, and chip-resistant. The heavy gauge aluminum core provides even heat distribution and prevents hot spots. Nonstick delivers exceptional performance, makes food release/cleaning easy, and allows for healthy cooking. Tempered glass lid with steam vent is protected by a stainless steel rim. Riveted stainless steel handles for strength stay cool and are comfortable. Not Induction compatible. Works on gas, electric, glass, ceramic, halogen, etc. Oven safe to 450F, glass lid is not oven safe. Hand wash recommended, not dishwasher safe.
feature_bullets: Has a hard anodized surface that is durable, heats evenly, and prevents hot spots
Nonstick performance for easy food release/cleaning and allows for healthy cooking
Tempered glass lid to view food; Riveted handles stay cool and are comfortable
Not Induction compatible; Works on gas, electric, glass, ceramic, halogen, etc.
Oven safe to 450F, except lid. Hand wash recommended, not dishwasher safe

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
